info.description: The DM Work (Definitions) API uses defined messages to query (get) create (post), update (put) or delete individual versions of work definition objects which are Work Master, Workflow Specification, Test Specification, Spatial Definition, Work Alert Definition, Work Alert Template, Work Record Specification, Work Record Template, and Work Record Entry Template. The Post/object messages are used to create a definition of a specific object type. The Put/object messages are used to update a definition of a specific object type. Delete/object messages used to delete a definition of a specific object type. The DM Work Definitions API provides Developers the Get/object messages to query for definition versions of a specific object type.  The DM function services production and support operations by managing all Level 3 and some Level 2 information definition. The primary work definition object is the work master which is the requirements for a work task.  The work master contains the required bill of resources, the workflow specification for execution, and parameter specifications. The work master includes    1) Material specification object with material use for production operations as material produced, consumable, material consumed, by-product produced, co-product produced, and yield produced. The material specification is typically represents the manufacturing bill of materials (BoM).    2) Required equipment specifications and personnel specifications. The resource specifications define the applied resource definition or class objects.    3) Workflow specification object defines a workflow as a collection of nodes and connections with the rules for relationship and dependency. A node may reference a chilld work master for more detail. The workflow specification can reference a master recipe (ANSI/ISA-88.00.01 and IEC 61512-1 definitions), standard operating procedure (SOP), standard operating conditions (SOC), routing, or assembly steps based on the production strategy used.      4) parameter specification object defines the job order specific parameters and rule sets which instructs how L3 manufacturing operations and L2 process sequences how to execute production or supporting operations.     Each work master (ISA-95 Part 4) defined its scope to an equipment heirachy level as either general, site, work cell, unit or lower.  The DM specifications are sent and applied by other Level 3 functions and Level 2 functions. DM Administration includes management of the  distribution of DM specifications to systems across L2-L4. Some of the product production rule sets as equipment and process production rule sets may exist in Level 2 controllers and devices. When that is the case, exchanges of this L2 information shall be coordinated with production execution management and data collection management activities DM information is used by production execution management function to provide operational commands to L2 equipment controllers and devices; the operational commands provides as the workflow specification is executed per the job order.
info.title: Definition Management Work API

get.description: Gets work masters (definitions) with specific IDs

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Work master ID (work definition ID)

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: Work master ID version to retrieve.

delete.description: Delete existing work masters from the system

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Work Master ID

put.description: Update existing work masters by IDs in the system

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Work master ID

parameters.name: workMaster
parameters.description: The new state of the work master.

get.description: By passing in appropriate options, search for available work masters in the system

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: the unique identifier of the work master to retrieve

parameters.name: hierarchyScopeId
parameters.description: The hierarchy scope to retrieve work masters by

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: the number of results to return

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: Work master ID version to retrieve.

200.description: search results matching criteria for work masters

post.description: Creates new work masters in the system

parameters.name: workMaster
parameters.description: Work master to create

workMaster.description: A work master is defineid as the bill of resources, parameters and routing (workflow specifications) required to perform a unit of work without reference to a specific job order with a definitionType attribute with value of pattern or with a reference to specific job order order with a definitionType attribute with value of instance.

id.description: Required attribute. A unique identification as the work master ID

version.description: Required attribute. A identification of the version of the work master version.  In cases where there are multiple versions of a work master, then the version attribute shall contain the additional identification information to differentiate each version.

description.description: Contains additional information and descriptions of the work master.

hierarchyScopeId.description: Identifies where the exchanged information fits within the role based equipment hierarchy.

workMasterChildIds.description: Unique identifications of the children of the work master as work master IDs which make up part of the parent work master as the whole.

workMasterParentId.description: Unique identifications of the parent work masters as work master IDs which make up whole of the child work master as the part.

workType.description: Describes the category of work. Required attribute. Defined values are: production, maintenance, quality, inventory, or mixed.  “Mixed” shall be used when the work definition contains resources and routing information required to perform several types of work.

definitionType.description: Defines the type of the work master.Defined values are pattern as a work master used as a template for other work masters and an instance as a work master directly scheduled, dispatched and executed.

publishedDate.description: The date and time on which the work master was published or generated
publishedDate.example: ISO 8601: yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss for local time as 2002-09-22T09:15:23

effectiveFrom.description: Custom non-ISA-95 attribute for BHP requirements. The timestamp that this Work Master is applicable from.
effectiveFrom.example: ISO 8601: yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss for local time as 2002-09-22T09:15:23

effectiveTo.description: Custom non-ISA-95 attribute for BHP requirements. The timestamp that this Work Master is applicable to.
effectiveTo.example: ISO 8601: yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss for local time as 2002-09-22T09:15:23

durationUnitOfMeasure.description: The units of measure of the duration, if defined.

workflowSpecificationId.description: This work master defined in part by the workflow specification. The version attribute of the work specification may be specified. In cases where used in multiple workflow master versions, then the version attribute shall contain the additional identification information to differentiate each version.

evalutatedPropertyIds.description: This evaluated property ID applies the work master as the test method to obtain the property measurement of the evaluated property for test specification of the testable object property ID.

processSegmentIds.description: The process segment(s) from the L4 master schedule or operations schedule associated to this work master. A process segment lists the classes of personnel, equipment, and material needed, and/or it may present specific resources, such as specific equipment needed for the process segment.

operationsDefinitionIds.description: The operations definition(s) from the L4 master schedule or operations schedule associated to this work master.  An operations definition defines the resources required to perform a specified operation. The actual definition of how to perform the operation is defined in a work definition.

operationsSegmentIds.description: The operations segment(s) from the L4 master schedule or operations schedule associated to this work master. If the operations segment reference is insufficient to identify the operations segment, then this work master should also identify the operations definition reference. An operations segment quantifies a segment for a specific operation in an operations definition.

parameterSpecification.description: An work master may have an associated set of zero or more parameter specifications. The parameter specification contains the names and types of the values that may be sent to the Level 3 systems to parameterize the work or operation. Parameter specifications may contain nested parameter specifications.

id.description: Identification of the parameter specification for a specific work master.

description.description: Contains additional information of the parameter.
description.example: Which Shift this work can be performed in

hierarchyScopeId.description: Identifies where the exchanged information fits within the role based equipment hierarchy. Optionally, hierarchy scope defines the scope of the object, such as the site or area.

parameterSpecificationChildIds.description: Unique identifications of the children of the parameter specification as parameter specification IDs which make up part of the parent parameter specification as the whole.

value.description: The value, set of values, or range of acceptable values.

valueUnitOfMeasure.description: Unit of measure of the values, if applicable.

personnelSpecification.description: An identification, reference, or correspondence to a personnel capability shall be presented as a personnel specification. A personnel specification usually specifies personnel class but may specify a person by ID. This identifies the specific personnel capability that is associated with the identified work master, operations segment or product segment.

id.description: Identification of the personnel specification for a specific work master.

description.description: Contains additional information of the personnel specification.

hierarchyScopeId.description: Identifies where the exchanged information fits within the role based equipment hierarchy. Optionally, hierarchy scope defines the scope of the object, such as the site or area.

personnelClassIds.description: Identifies the associated personnel class or set of personnel classes of the personnel specification for a specific work master.

personIds.description: Identifies the associated person or set of persons of the personnel specification for a specific work master.

personnelSpecificationChildIds.description: Unique identifications of children of the personnel specification as parameter specification IDs which make up part of the parent personnel specification as the whole.

spatialDefinition.description: Spatially defines the personnel resource(s) specified by this personnel specification as a 0-dimensional point, 1-dimensional line, or 2-dimensional shape or 3-dimensional solid.

testSpecificationIds.description: Unique identifications of the test specification(s) as the test specification IDs used to evaluate this personnel specification.

personnelUse.description: Defines the expected use of the personnel class or person.

quantity.description: Specifies the amount of personnel resources required for the parent work master, if applicable.

quantityUnitOfMeasure.description: The unit of measure of the associated quantity, if applicable.

personnelSpecificationProperty.description: Personnel specification properties may contain nested personnel specification properties.

id.description: Identification of the equipment specification for a specific work master.

description.description: Contains additional information and descriptions of the personnel specification property definition.

personnelClassPropertyId.description: Identifies the associated personnel class property or set of personnel class properties related to this personnel specification property for a specific work master.

personPropertyIds.description: Identifies the associated person property or set of person properties related to this personnel specification property for a specific work master.

personnelSpecificationPropertyChildIds.description: Unique identifications of children of the personnel specification property as personnel specification property IDs which make up part of the parent personnel specification property as the whole.

value.description: The value, set of values, or range of the property. For example: Apprentice, Journeyman, Master.

valueUnitOfMeasure.description: The unit of measure of the associated property value, if applicable.

quantity.description: Specifies the amount of personnel resources required for the parent work master, if applicable.

quantityUnitOfMeasure.description: The unit of measure of the associated quantity, if applicable.

equipmentSpecification.description: An identification, reference, or correspondence to an equipment capability shall be used as an equipment specification. An equipment specification may specify either an equipment class or a piece of equipment. This identifies the specific equipment capability that is associated with the work master.

id.description: Identification of the equipment specification for a specific work master.

description.description: Contains additional information and descriptions of the equipment specification.

hierarchyScopeId.description: Identifies where the exchanged information fits within the role based equipment hierarchy. Optionally, hierarchy scope defines the scope of the object, such as the site or area.

equipmentClassIds.description: Identifies the associated equipment class or set of equipment classes of the equipment specification for a specific work master.

equipmentIds.description: Identifies the associated equipment or set of equipment of the equipment specification for a specific work master.

equipmentSpecificationChildIds.description: Unique identifications of children of the equipment specification as equipment specification IDs which make up part of the parent equipment specification as the whole.

spatialDefinition.description: Spatially defines the equipment resource(s) specified by this equipment specification as a 0-dimensional point, 1-dimensional line, or 2-dimensional shape or 3-dimensional solid.

testSpecificationIds.description: Unique identifications of the test specification(s) as the test specification IDs used to evaluate this equipment specification.

equipmentUse.description: Defines the expected use of the equipment class or equipment.

quantity.description: Specifies the amount of equipment resources required for the parent work master, if applicable.

quantityUnitOfMeasure.description: The unit of measure of the associated quantity, if applicable.

equipmentSpecificationProperty.description: Equipment specification properties may contain nested equipment specification properties.

id.description: An identification of the associated equipment property or equipment class property for a specific work master.

description.description: Contains additional information and descriptions of the equipment specification property definition.

equipmentClassPropertyId.description: Identifies the associated equipment class property or set of equipment class properties related to this equipment specification property for a specific work master.

equipmentPropertyIds.description: Identifies the associated equipment property or set of equipment properties related to this equipment specification property for a specific work master.

equipmentSpecificationPropertyChildIds.description: Unique identifications of children of the equipment specification property as equipment specification property IDs which make up part of the parent equipment specification property as the whole.

value.description: The value, set of values, or range of the property.  For example: Wet, Dry.

valueUnitOfMeasure.description: The unit of measure of the associated property value, if applicable.

quantity.description: Specifies the amount of equipment resources required for the parent work master, if applicable.

quantityUnitOfMeasure.description: The unit of measure of the associated quantity, if applicable.

materialSpecification.description: An identification or correspondence to a material capability shall be presented as a material specification. A material specification specifies a material or a material class. This identifies the specific material specification that is associated with the identified product work maste.

id.description: Identification of the material specification for a specific work master.

description.description: Contains additional information and descriptions of the material specification.

hierarchyScopeId.description: Identifies where the exchanged information fits within the role based equipment hierarchy. Optionally, hierarchy scope defines the scope of the object, such as the site or area.

materialClassIds.description: Identifies the associated material class or set of material classes of the material specification for a specific work master.

materialDefinitionIds.description: Identifies the associated material definition or set of material definition of the material specification for a specific work master.

materialLotIds.description: Identifies the associated material lot or set of material lot of the specification for a specific work master. Typically, either a material class or material definition is specified.

materialSublotIds.description: Identifies the associated material sublot or set of material sublot of the specification for a specific work master. Typically, either a material class or material definition is specified.

materialSpecificationChildIds.description: Unique identifications of children of the material specification as material specification IDs which make up part of the parent material specification as the whole.

spatialDefinition.description: Spatially defines the material resource(s) specified by this material specification as a 0-dimensional point, 1-dimensional line, or 2-dimensional shape or 3-dimensional solid.

testSpecificationIds.description: Unique identifications of the test specification(s) as the test specification IDs used to evaluate this material specification.

materialUse.description: Defined values for production operations are consumable, material consumed, material produced, by-product produced, co-product produced, and yield produced; for maintenance operations are consumable, material consumed, and material produced; for quality test operations are consumable, destructive sample, returned sample, and retained sample; and for inventory operations defined values are consumable, material consumed, material produced, and inventoried.

quantity.description: Specifies the amount of material resources required for the parent work master, if applicable.

quantityUnitOfMeasure.description: The unit of measure of the associated property value, if applicable.

assemblyType.description: Defines the type of the assembly. Defined types are physical, the components of the assembly are physically connected or in the same area; and logical, the components of the assembly are not necessarily physically connected or in the same area.

assemblyRelationship.description: Defines the type of the relationships. Defined types are  permanent, an assembly that is not intended to be split during the production process; and transient, a temporary assembly using during production, such as a pallet of different materials or a batch kit.

materialSpecificationProperty.description: Material specification properties may contain nested material specification properties.

id.description: An identification of the associated material property for a specific work master.

description.description: Contains additional information and descriptions of the material specification property.

materialClassPropertyId.description: Identifies the associated material class property or set of material class properties related to this material specification property for a specific work master.

materialDefinitionPropertyId.description: Identifies the associated material definition property or set of material definition properties related to this material specification property for a specific work master.

materialLotPropertyIds.description: Identifies the associated material lot property or set of material lot properties related to this material specification property for a specific work master.

materialSpecificationPropertyChildIds.description: Unique identifications of children of the material specification property as material specification property IDs which make up part of the parent material specification property as the whole.

value.description: The value, set of values, or range for the associated property.

valueUnitOfMeasure.description: The unit of measure of the associated property value, if applicable.

quantity.description: Specifies the amount of material resources required for the parent work master, if applicable.

quantityUnitOfMeasure.description: The unit of measure of the associated property value, if applicable.

workflowSpecification.description: A workflow specification is a first order object represented as a collection of workflow specification nodes and workflow specification connections. The workflow specification can be exchanged directly as set of reusable definition or referenced from a work master.  Each node is defined by a workflow specification node type definition, and each collection is defined by a workflow specification node type definition. A workflow specificaation node may be referenced from a work master and contain a reference to a work master.  Different workflow formats shall be represented as collections of node types and connection types.

id.description: Required attribute. Uniquely identifies the workflow specification definition.

description.description: Contains additional information and descriptions of the workflow specification.

version.description: Customer ISA-95 attribute for BHP requirement. The version of this workflow specification.

hierarchyScopeId.description: Identifies where the exchanged information fits within the role based equipment hierarchy. Optionally, hierarchy scope defines the scope of the object, such as the site or area.

definitionType.description: Defines the type of the workflow specification. Defined types are a pattern as a workflow specification that is used as a template for other workflow specifications and an  instance as a workflow specification that may be directly executed

workflowSpecificationParentIds.description: This workflow specification includes the properties of the parent workflow specification.

workflowSpecificationNodes.description: This workflow specification defined in part by this workflow specification node(s).

workflowSpecificationConnections.description: This workflow specification defined in part by this workflow specification connection(s).

workflowSpecificationProperty.description: A property of a workflow specification shall be defined as a workflow specification property. Workflow specification properties may be used to specify the defined properties that can be associated with the specific workflow specification.

id.description: A unique identification of a workflow specification property.

description.description: Additional information about the workflow specification property.

workflowSpecificationPropertyChildIds.description: Unique identifications of children of the workflow specification property as workflow specification property IDs which make up part

value.description: The default value, set of values, or range of the workflow specification property.

valueUnitOfMeasure.description: The unit of measure of the associated workflow specification property value, if applicable.

workflowSpecificationNode.description: A workflow specification node is a reference to a work master, a contained workflow specification, or an entity used in the represented format (such as a decision element, transition condition, or starting point).

id.description: Uniquely identifies the workflow specification node definition.

description.description: Contains additional information and descriptions of the workflow specification node.

hierarchyScopeId.description: Identifies where the exchanged information fits within the role based equipment hierarchy. Optionally, hierarchy scope defines the scope of the object, such as the site or area.

workflowSpecificationNodeTypeId.description: This workflow specification node defined by this workflow specification node type.

workflowSpecificationId.description: Contains an optional identification of workflow specification defined in part by this workflow specification node.

workflowSpecificationNodeParentId.description: This workflow specification node(s) includes the properties of the parent workflow specification node.

workMasterIds.description: The work master defined in part by this workflow specification node. The version attribute of the work master may be specified. In cases where there are multiple versions of a work master, then the version attribute shall contain the additional identification information to differentiate each version.

workDirectiveIds.description: The work directive defined in part by this workflow specification node. The version of the work directive may be specified in the version attribute of this workflow specification node.

toWorkflowSpecificationConnectionIds.description: This workflow specification node(s) to the workflow specification connection(s).

fromWorkflowSpecificationConnectionIds.description: The workflow specification connection(s) from this workflow specification node(s).

workflowSpecificationNodeProperty.description: A property of a workflow specification node shall be defined as a workflow specification node property. Workflow specification node properties may be used to specify the defined properties that can be associated with the specific node type.

id.description: A unique identification of a property.

description.description: Additional information about the property.

workflowSpecificationNodeTypePropertyId.description: If the workflow specification node supports a workflow specification node type, the workflow specification node type property is applied in this workflow specification node property(s). This workflow specification node property maps to the corresponding workflow specification node type property

workflowSpecificationNodePropertyChildId.description: The child workflow specification node properties of this workflow specification node property.

value.description: The default value, set of values, or range of the property.

valueUnitOfMeasure.description: The unit of measure of the associated property value, if applicable.

workflowSpecificationConnection.description: A workflow specification connection represents a many-to-many link between workflow specification nodes.

id.description: Uniquely identifies the workflow specification connection definition.

description.description: Contains additional information and descriptions of the workflow specification connection.

workflowSpecificationConnectionTypeId.description: This workflow specification connection defined by this workflow specification node type by idenification.

workflowSpecificationId.description: Contains an optional identification of workflow specification defined in part by this workflow specification node.

toWorkflowSpecificationNodeIds.description: This workflow specification connection to the workflow specification node.

fromWorkflowSpecificationNodeIds.description: The workflow specification node from this workflow specification connection.

workflowSpecificationConnectionProperty.description: A property of a workflow specification connection shall be defined as a workflow specification connection property.  Workflow specification connection properties may be used to specify the defined properties that can be associated with the specific connection.

id.description: A unique identification of a workflow specification connection property.

description.description: Additional information about the workflow specification connection property.

workflowSpecificationConnectionTypePrope.description: If the workflow specification connection supports a workflow specification connection type, the workflow specification connection type property is applied in this workflow specification connection property(s). This workflow specification connection property maps to the corresponding workflow specification connection type property

workflowSpecificationConnectionPropertyC.description: The child workflow specification connection properties of this workflow specification connection property.

value.description: The default value, set of values, or range of the workflow specification connection property.

valueUnitOfMeasure.description: The unit of measure of the associated workflow specification connection property value, if applicable.

workflowSpecificationNodeType.description: A workflow specification node type defines the properties that can be associated with a specific workflow specification node.

id.description: Uniquely identifies the workflow specification node definition.

version.description: Customer ISA-95 attribute for BHP requirement. The version of this workflow specification node type.

description.description: Contains additional information and descriptions of the workflow specification node.

workflowSpecificationNodeTypeProperty.description: A property of a workflow specification node type shall be defined as a workflow specification node type property.  Workflow specification node properties types specify the allowed properties that can be associated with a specific workflow specification node.

id.description: A unique identification of a workflow specification node type property.

description.description: Additional information about the workflow specification node type property.

workflowSpecificationNodeTypePropertyChi.description: The child workflow specification node type properties of this workflow specification node type property.

value.description: The default value, set of values, or range of the workflow specification node type property.

valueUnitOfMeasure.description: The unit of measure of the associated workflow specification node type property value, if applicable.

workflowSpecificationConnectionType.description: A workflow specification connection type specifies the permissible information on a connection.

id.description: Uniquely identifies the workflow specification connection definition.

version.description: Custom non-ISA-95 attribute for BHP requirement. The version of this workflow connection type.

description.description: Contains additional information and descriptions of the workflow specification connection.

fromMultiplicity.description: Defines the multiplicity of the from connection: one, one or more, zero or more, or an allowed range.

toMultiplicity.description: Defines the multiplicity of the “to” connection: one, one or more, zero or more, or an allowed range.

workflowSpecificationConnectionTypePrope.description: A property of a workflow specification connection type shall be defined as a workflow specification connection type property.  Workflow specification connection properties types specify the allowed properties that can be associated with a specific workflow specification connections.

id.description: A unique identification of a workflow specification connection type property.

description.description: Additional information about the workflow specification connection type property.

workflowSpecificationConnectionPropertyC.description: The child workflow specification connection type properties of this workflow specification connection type property.

value.description: The default value, set of values, or range of the workflow specification connection type property.

valueUnitOfMeasure.description: The unit of measure of the associated workflow specification connection type property value, if applicable.

testSpecification.description: The test specification details the test specification criteria and the tested evaluated property(s) required for a testable object (personnel class, person, equipment class, equipment, material class, material definition, material lot, material sublot) to match the quality or performance requirements of an operations requirement from a schedule, the business or particular customers. The test specification communicates the test tolerances and related target values for a specific testable object referencing a set of operations test requirements for context of the test. A test specification may contain other test specifications to form a hierarchy of test specifications. When a hierarchy of test specifications are used, the result of the parent object in the hierarchy shall be the worst-case result of all the respective child object results.

id.description: Required attribute. Uniquely identifies a test specification for certifying one or more test specification criteria for one or more evaluated property.

version.description: An identification of the version of the test specification.

description.description: Contains additional information and descriptions of the test specification.

hierarchyScopeId.description: Identifies where the exchanged information fits within the role based equipment hierarchy. Optionally, hierarchy scope defines the scope of the object, such as the site or area.

testSpecificationChildIds.description: The child test specifications of this test specification..

operationsTestRequirementIds.description: The operations test requirement ID(s) evaluated by this test specification.

testableObjectIds.description: The ID of the testable object tested by this test specification

effectiveStartDate.description: The effective start date and time for use of the test specification or set of test specifications
effectiveStartDate.example: ISO 8601: yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss for local time as 2002-09-22T09:15:23

effectiveEndDate.description: The effective end date and time for use of the test specification or set of test specifications
effectiveEndDate.example: ISO 8601: yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss for local time as 2002-09-22T09:15:23

publishedDate.description: The date and time test specification was published or generated
publishedDate.example: ISO 8601: yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss for local time as 2002-09-22T09:15:23

testSampleSize.description: Sample size required to perform the test.

physicalSample.description: Defines whether physical sampling is required to perform the test. Defined values are yes for physical samples are required and no for physical samples are not required.

recurranceQuantity.description: The amount of operations activity required between samples.

recurrenceTimeInterval.description: The duration of operational activity required between samples

testSpecificationProperty.description: The test specification property object defines properties of the test specification. These properties are not the characteristics to be tested.

id.description: A unique identification of a test specification property.

description.description: Additional information about the test specification property.

testSpecificationPropertyChildIds.description: Unique identifications of children of the test specification property as test specification property IDs which make up part

value.description: The default value, set of values, or range of the test specification property.

valueUnitOfMeasure.description: The unit of measure of the associated test specification property value, if applicable.

testSpecificationCriteria.description: The test specification criteria object defines the set of criterion to evaluate and the test result to be reported when a testable object satisfies those criteria. This test specification criteria used to evaluate the evaluated property of a testable object property.

id.description: Uniquely identifies the test specification criteria definition.

description.description: Contains additional information and descriptions of the test specification criteria.

sequence.description: Specifies the sequence of evaluation of test specification criteria. The sequence shall be executed lowest first. Duplicate sequence values shall be executed in parallel with worst case result reported if both criterion are evaluated as true.

expression.description: An expression of the test specification criteria to be evaluated. If the expression is empty, then the test specification criteria represents the else criterion.
expression.example: If (criterion 1) then ‘pass’ else if (criterion 2) then ‘warn’ else ‘fail’.

result.description: The value to be given to the result of the test if the test specification criteria expression is evaluated as true

evaluatedPropertyIds.description: The test specification criteria used to evaluate this evaluated property(s) of a testable object property.

evaluatedProperty.description: The evaluated property object identifies the set of testable object / testable object property pairs to be measured and the applicable test method to obtain a property measurement. This test specification criteria used to evaluate the evaluated property of a testable object property.

id.description: A unique identification of an evaluated property.

description.description: Additional information about an evaluated property.

testableObjectPropertyIds.description: The testable object property ID which is to be measured by this test specification.

workMasterIds.description: The work master ID or work directive ID which is applied test method to obtain the measurement of this evaluated property for test specification of the testable object property ID.

testSpecificationCriteriaIds.description: This test specification criteria used to evaluate the evaluated property of a testable object property.

workAlertTemplate.description: A notification of a Level 3 event shall be defined as a work alert. the work alert template is the form of the work alert message where the work alert definition defines the content. Not all events warrant creating a work alert. A work alert does not require acknowledgement. If acknowledgement is needed, then an alarm model may be used (see ISA-18.00.02 (IEC 62682), for information on alarms). Work alerts may be generated by any Level 3 activity. Work alert definitions are descriptions of the available types of work alerts.

id.description: Required attribute. Uniquely identifies a work alert template.

description.description: Contains additional information and descriptions of the work alert template.
description.example: Work alert template for SOP complete for Extraction

version.description: Customer ISA-95 attribute for BHP requirement. The version of this work alert template.

messageText.description: Form of Textual content of the work alert.

timestamp.description: Timestamp the work alert was generated.
timestamp.example: ISO 8601: yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss for local time as 2002-09-22T09:15:23

priority.description: Guide to the relative level of importance of the value for the work alert. Standard priority types are to be defined.

category.description: General grouping associated with a work alert definition.

workAlertTemplateProperty.description: The work alert template shall define the form of the work alert message using work alert template properties.

id.description: A unique identification of a work alert template property.

description.description: Additional information about the work alert template property.

workAlertDefinitionPropertyId.description: If the parent work alert supports a work alert definition, the work alert definition property(s) is applied in this work alert property(s). This work alert property maps to the corresponding work alert definition property.

workAlertPropertyChildIds.description: Unique identifications of children of the work alert template property as work alert template property IDs which make up part

value.description: The default value, set of values, or range of the work alert template property.

valueUnitOfMeasure.description: The unit of measure of the associated work alert template property value, if applicable.

workAlertDefinition.description: Work alert messages may be generated by any Level 3 activity in the form of the work alert template. Work alert definitions are descriptions of the available types of work alerts. A notification of a Level 3 event shall be defined as a work alert. Not all events warrant creating a work alert. A work alert does not require acknowledgement. If acknowledgement is needed, then an alarm model may be used (see ISA-18.00.02 (IEC 62682), for information on alarms).

id.description: Required attribute. Uniquely identifies a work alert definition.

version.description: Customer ISA-95 attribute for BHP requirement. The version of this work alert definition.

description.description: Contains additional information and descriptions of the work alert definition.

hierarchyScopeId.description: Identifies where the exchanged information fits within the role based equipment hierarchy.

priority.description: List of the priorities that act as a guide to the relative level of importance of a work alert.

category.description: General grouping associated with a work alert definition.

workAlertDefinitionProperty.description: The work alert definition shall be defined as property on a work alert definition property.

id.description: A unique identification of a work alert definition property.

description.description: Additional information about the work alert definition property.

workAlertDefinitionPropertyChildIds.description: Unique identifications of children of the work alert definition property as work alert definition property IDs which make up part

value.description: The default value, set of values, or range of the work alert definition property.

valueUnitOfMeasure.description: The unit of measure of the associated work alert definition property value, if applicable.

workRecordSpecification.description: Specification of the allowed content of work record objects in the API shall be defined as work record specifications. Information object contents in the work record vary depending on the process context of the work. The work record specification describes and specifies the information objects and associated actions that are allowed in the work record occurrence. The publisher/sender shall follow this work record specification to construct the instance message in the work record template and work record entry template corresponding to the work record specification ID. Subscribers/receivers shall use the work record specification to validate the content of the instance message in the form of templates.

id.description: Required attribute. Identification within the associated work record specification. Work record instances include this value with their work record object to enable recognition / validation of the message contents.

version.description: Customer ISA-95 attribute for BHP requirement. The version of this work record specification.

description.description: Contains additional information and descriptions of the work record specification.
description.example: Work record specification for Extraction Results

workRecordSpecificationChildIds.description: Unique identifications of children of the work record specification as work record specification IDs which make up part of the whole definition.

informationObjectTypeIds.description: Permitted set of information objects allowed in the work record instance. The work record entry contains the attributes to the information object for work record. An unconstrained set of values can be represented with the * entry.

informationObjectMultiplicity.description: The range of the information object(s) in work record entry allowed in the work record occurrence. If no limit is explicitly specified, the unbounded keyword is specified. If no multiplicity entry is specified, this is equivalent to no constraint.

action.description: The permitted set of actions applied to the work record entry object in the work s record by the publisher. Defined values for action are added, changed,  deleted, and observed. If no action is specified, this is equivalent to all actions being allowed.

actionMultiplicity.description: The range of actions allowed to be represented in the work record occurrence. If no limit is explicitly specified, the unbounded keyword is specified. If no multiplicity entry is specified, this is equivalent to no constraint.

workRecordTemplate.description: A work record template is used to define the form of the work record instance message. A work record instance is defined with its corresponding work record specification to represent the combination of objects that are considered relevant to the work being documented. The bundle of work record entries are pertinent to the work record information shall be defined as work records and in the form of the specific defined work record entry template.

id.description: A unique identification of a work record template. Required attribute. The ID attribute may be modified over the lifecycle of a work record, although it shall not be completely removed.

version.description: Current version of work record template.

description.description: Additional information about the work record template.
description.example: Work record template for High travel speed

hierarchyScopeId.description: Identifies where the exchanged information fits within the role based equipment hierarchy.

workRecordSpecificationId.description: The work record specification ID defines the information object(s) allowed to be contained within the instance of the associated work record entry in the instance of work record.  The specified action must match the value in the attribute, action, in this work record template and the instances of the associated work record.

workRecordTemplateChildIds.description: Unique identifications of children of the work record template as work record template IDs which make up part of the whole work record template

workRecordEntryTemplates.description: The work record entry template IDs defines the container for instances of work record entry (s) applying a common action attribute for each instance of work record.

creationDate.description: The date of the work record template or the instance of a work record was created.
creationDate.example: ISO 8601: yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss for local time as 2002-09-22T09:15:23

lastChangeDate.description: The date of the work record template or the instance of a work record was last changed.
lastChangeDate.example: ISO 8601: yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss for local time as 2002-09-22T09:15:23

changeIndication.description: An indication enabling detection that the work record has not been altered.    Also, the change indication enables detection that a work record has been altered, although may not identify the specific alterations.
changeIndication.example: E1, A string generated by an MD5 algorithm used as a hashing algorithm. E2, A string representing a digital key of the entire batch production record. E3, A string representing a checksum of the entire batch production record.

publishedDate.description: The date and time that the work record template or an instance of work record was published or generated
publishedDate.example: ISO 8601: yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss for local time as 2002-09-22T09:15:23

expirationDate.description: Date and time at which the work record is no longer relevant.
expirationDate.example: ISO 8601: yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss for local time as 2002-09-22T09:15:23

recordStatus.description: Current status of the work record template or instance of work record. This reflects the current position in a work record’s lifecycle.

campaignIds.description: The list of IDs of the campaigns associated with the instance of work record.

delimiter.description: Defines the character set to be used in delimiting elements in equipment IDs and procedural element reference.

language.description: The language used in the work record should be identified.  If multiple languages are used, the primary language should be identified here, and each instance where other languages are used throughout the batch production record a local reference to the language should be made.

workRecordEntryTemplate.description: A work record entry template is used to define the form of the work record entry in an instance of the work record message. A work record entry instance is defined with its corresponding work record specification to represent the combination of objects that are considered relevant to the work being documented. The bundle of work record entries are pertinent to the work record information shall be defined as work records and in the form of the specific defined work record entry template. The work record entry shall be a single information object and any third-party manufacturing operations message profile within an work record template. There shall be one or more work record entry objects in a work record. For example, work schedule and material lot as information objects require two work record entry objects in a work record.

id.description: A unique identification of a work record entry template. Required attribute. The ID attribute may be modified over the lifecycle of a work record template, although it shall not be completely removed.

description.description: Additional information about the work record entry template.
description.example: Work record entry template for High travel speed

version.description: Custome non-ISA-95 attribute. Current version of work record entry template.

workRecordTemplanteId.description: The work record template ID defines the instance of the associated work record entry in the instance of work record.

workRecordEntryTemplateChildIds.description: Unique identifications of children of the work record entry template as work record entry template IDs which make up part of the whole work record entry template

informationObject.description: An embedded information object. If data is referenced in this work record entry, this attribute is not used. The format of the information object is specified in the associated work record specification.

informationObjectId.description: The reference to external data (Defined (ISA-95) information object) which is stored external to this work record entry. If data is embedded in this work record entry, the attribute is not used. The format of the reference is specified in this work record specification.

informationObjectReference.description: The reference to external data (information object) which is stored external to this work record entry. If data is embedded in this work record entry, the attribute is not used. The format of the reference is specified in the work record specification.

informationObjectType.description: Identifies the type of information object type that a work record entry is based upon. The allowed information object types are defined in the work record specification.

effectiveTimestamp.description: The date and time that the work record entry was/is effective. If no effective timestamp is provided with work record entry, the effective timestamp is represented by the effective timestamp attribute in the work record.
effectiveTimestamp.example: ISO 8601: yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss for local time as 2002-09-22T09:15:23

recordTimestamp.description: The date and time the publisher recorded / transacted the action. If no entry is provided, the record timestamp is the record timestamp attribute in the work record.
recordTimestamp.example: ISO 8601: yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss for local time as 2002-09-22T09:15:23
